content.description: Hardest part is the very beginning, then the rest is cake. Easiest established route on the boulder.
content.protection: Two anchors at the top, which are admittedly pretty manky. One might consider throwing a quickdraw in each anchor loop and then a third in the adjacent piton, which is also pretty rusty. Drop at your own risk.
content.location: Only established route up the north side. Scramble up the northeast corner to set up on the anchors.

content.description: no anchors up top so you will have to descend  off the east face.
content.location: farthest right route on the south face

content.description: the route goes up to left edge of the south face
content.protection: 4 bolts. no top anchors. you will need to descend off the east side. it may be good to use a quick clip on this. the landing is sketch
content.location: its the far left route on the south face of the rock

content.description: This is a challenging route, mostly due to the backward incline throughout. A lot of strength and strategic hold planning is necessary to reach the top. Have a steady belayer, and expect to swing out a good bit if you fall. In fact, bring a third person to grab your ankle whilst hanging and fling you back toward the wall. Then, hold on for dear life, lest you swing once more.
content.protection: One bolt anchor at the top, with a few sturdy chain links coming off it. Would recommend attaching one or two quickdraws and running your line through them.
content.location: Only established route on the southwest corner of the big rock. Scramble up the northeast corner to get on top and set your rope through the established bolt and chain.
